message: ( forked from https://convore.com/kynetx/feature-requeset-httphead/ )
yes exactly.
not being critical here, just want to understand.
So you want a way to send an event to node.js without having to go through a RESTful interface?
maybe with an url
we do have a node module for signaling events into kns from node, but not the other way around.
how would you identify the node app that will get the event?
so you have a url, but don't want to just GET or POST to it?
Inside a prelude I was not thinking of calling an app but evaluating javascript, something like : evalOnNodejs(someJs)
and more reliable
in the postlude i don't mind making a get or a post if that's possible
I also think that the first mechanism avoids a network call so should be faster
"yes: the open source engine is your route to that." => Fantastic
and call them with post and get
so we can reuse existing libraries
yes, and maybe also evaluate php, cobol..shell script , c#
We can of course put a webservice in front of all those environments
ah, so you want to eval a block of js in node.
just feel that calling special functions with namespaces for php , js, would make it simpler
yes: the open source engine is your route to that.
